DOC.brief_summary: The goal study assess effect consumption lean pork-containing , high-protein breakfast versus refine carbohydrate-rich breakfast satiety cardiometabolic parameter overweight obese adult pre-diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Lean Pork , High Protein Breakfast Satiety Metabolic Health Pre-diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , crossover trial include two screen visit , one baseline visit , two test period 2 week , end test visit , separate 2-week washout . Subjects consume day refine carbohydrate-rich breakfast contain 8/66/26 % kcal protein/carbohydrate/fat , respectively ( Control Condition ) , high pork protein breakfast contain 35/39/26 % kcal protein/carbohydrate/fat , respectively ( Active Condition ) . Study product daily breakfast consumption dispense subject begin test period . Subjects complete 3-day diet record baseline end test period , daily Appetite Visual Analog Scale ( VAS ) Diary asses perceive hunger fullness even retire throughout test period . VAS assessment hunger , fullness , desire eat , prospective food consumption , focus energy also assess clinic visit end test period , pre- post-breakfast consumption ( multiple time point ) . Subjects also complete palatability questionnaire test period . Blood sample collect fast baseline pre- post-breakfast consumption ( multiple sampling ) end test period evaluate glucose , insulin , lipoprotein lipid concentration .
